meanings.definition: A point or level below which a quantity or condition is not allowed to fall.
meanings.sent1: The teacher set the lows for the test scores to ensure everyone did their best.
meanings.sent2: The lows of the temperature in winter can be quite challenging for plants.
meanings.sent3: Feeling sad when you reach the lows in your mood is normal, but remember, it will pass.
meanings.sent4: During tough times, it's important to remember that even at the lows, there is always a way up.
meanings.sent5: The lows of the ocean can be mysterious and full of undiscovered creatures.

meanings.definition: A state of depression or low spirits.
meanings.sent1: She experienced deep lows after losing her pet, but her friends helped her through.
meanings.sent2: The lows of loneliness can be overwhelming, but reaching out for support can make a difference.
meanings.sent3: Even in the lows of a sad movie, there can be moments of laughter and joy.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt heavy with the lows of sorrow, but he knew brighter days would come.
meanings.sent5: The lows of despair can feel endless, but there is always a glimmer of hope to hold on to.

meanings.definition: The part of a wave that is below the average level.
meanings.sent1: Surfers enjoy riding the highs and lows of the waves, feeling the rush of each crest.
meanings.sent2: The lows of the wave can be tricky to navigate, requiring skill and balance.
meanings.sent3: The lows of the wave seemed to whisper secrets of the deep ocean to the surfer.
meanings.sent4: As the wave reached its lows, the surfer prepared to catch the next thrilling crest.
meanings.sent5: The lows of the wave crashed gently on the shore, leaving a trail of foamy bubbles.
